p: Previous distributional maps of S. alatum [ 12],[ 13] indicate that the western border of the species range is located between the Armenian Highlands and the Anatolian Plateau around a longitude of 40°E. Ecological niche modelling together with occurrences found in the preparation of this study suggest that it extends further west until 27°E. However, this western part of the range in a greater part is represented by patchy appearances, while the continuous range is located in the area that was found in the previous studies.
